content: The concept phase involves consideration of vehicle-level functionality as implemented in items.
In this clause, the item and its operational environment are identified as an 'Item definition' (see 9.3), which forms the basis for subsequent activities.
This clause also specifies cybersecurity goals for the item (see 9.4), which are the highest-level requirements.
Cybersecurity risks are assessed using the methods of Clause 15, and cybersecurity claims are used to justify risk retention or sharing.
The cybersecurity concept (see 9.5) consists of cybersecurity requirements and requirements on the operational environment, both derived from the cybersecurity goals.
The objectives of this clause are to:
a) define the item, its operational environment, and their interactions in the context of cybersecurity;
b) specify cybersecurity goals and cybersecurity claims; and
c) specify the cybersecurity concept to achieve cybersecurity goals.
Existing information regarding the item and its operational environment can be considered.
For example, in-vehicle E/E system architecture, internal and external networks, and documentation from earlier developments.

description: The following information on the item shall be identified:
a) item boundary;
b) item functions; and
c) preliminary architecture.
Information about the operational environment of the item relevant to cybersecurity shall be described.

work_products.description: Item definition, resulting from the requirements of 9.3.2.

description: An analysis based on the item definition shall be performed that involves:
a) asset identification in accordance with 15.3;
b) threat scenario identification in accordance with 15.4;
c) impact rating in accordance with 15.5;
d) attack path analysis in accordance with 15.6;
e) attack feasibility rating in accordance with 15.7; and
f) risk value determination in accordance with 15.8.
Based on the results of RQ-09-03, risk treatment options shall be determined for each threat scenario in accordance with 15.9.
If the risk treatment decision for a threat scenario includes reducing the risk, one or more corresponding cybersecurity goals shall be specified.
If the risk treatment decision for a threat scenario includes sharing the risk or retaining the risk due to analysis assumptions, one or more corresponding cybersecurity claims shall be specified.
A verification shall be performed to confirm:
a) correctness and completeness of the analysis results (RQ-09-03) with respect to the item definition;
b) completeness, correctness, and consistency of risk treatment decisions (RQ-09-04) with respect to analysis results;
c) completeness, correctness, and consistency of cybersecurity goals (RQ-09-05) and claims (RQ-09-06) with respect to treatment decisions;
d) consistency of all cybersecurity goals and claims for the item.

work_products.description: TARA, resulting from RQ-09-03 and RQ-09-04.
Verification report for cybersecurity goals, resulting from RQ-09-07.

description: Technical and/or operational cybersecurity controls and their interactions to achieve the cybersecurity goals shall be described, taking into account:
a) dependencies between item functions; and/or
b) cybersecurity claims.
Cybersecurity requirements of the item and requirements on the operational environment shall be defined for the cybersecurity goals in accordance with RQ-09-08.
Cybersecurity requirements shall be allocated to the item and, if applicable, to one or more of its components.
The results of RQ-09-08, RQ-09-09, and RQ-09-10 shall be verified to confirm:
a) completeness, correctness, and consistency with cybersecurity goals; and
b) consistency with cybersecurity claims.

work_products.description: Cybersecurity concept, resulting from RQ-09-08, RQ-09-09, and RQ-09-10.
Verification report for the cybersecurity concept, resulting from RQ-09-11.
